info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 3 at 3:28PM CDT until June 6 at 4:49AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
Whitewater River at Towanda affecting Butler County.
Whitewater River at Augusta affecting Cowley and Butler Counties.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Whitewater River at Augusta.
* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to early Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Widespread flooding of agricultural and low-lying areas can be anticipated. Several roads are inundated with flood waters especially on the west side of town.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 28.8 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING
